triples.name: Social Network
triples.relevance: Provides the foundational framework for studying cooperative dynamics among interconnected social actors.

triples.name: Public Goods Game
triples.relevance: The game-theoretic model employed to analyze how individuals make decisions about contributing to collective resources in groups.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Mathematical structure used to represent higher-order interactions where edges connect more than two vertices.

triples.name: Replicator Equation
triples.relevance: Mathematical framework for modeling how strategy frequencies evolve over time in population dynamics.

triples.name: Evolutionary Dynamics
triples.relevance: Theoretical foundation for understanding how cooperation and strategies evolve in populations over time.

triples.name: Hub (Network Science)
triples.relevance: Network nodes with high degree that significantly influence the structure and information flow in networks.

triples.name: Cooperative Game Theory
triples.relevance: Game-theoretic framework for analyzing how coalitions form and cooperate to achieve mutual benefits.

triples.name: Synergy
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel method to empirically extract and characterize how synergy factors depend on group size from real-world collaboration data.
